page.title: 20Wivelsfield - Local History
page.content: Historic Houses :- {Great Ote Hall -}1550. Half- timbered under a Horsham slate roof. {Abbotsleigh -}The house of the estate which once owned most of the area. {Antye}- built in 1626.Traces of a moat have been found. {Pepper Hall}- early 17th century house with a fine central chimney stack. {-------------------------------------- Part of Wivelsfield Green was the site of{Allwood's Carnation Nursery. The{Queen Mother}once visited the nursery,which provided jobs for more than 100 people, many of whom would travel by bicycle from other villages.Two roads of modern houses now occupy the land, one of which bears the name of Allwood Crescent. {-------------------------------------- {** Survey compiled by the children and {staff of Wivelsfield CP.School 1985 **
